name: P.J.'s Chair - Ceccotti Collezioni
description: P.J.'s Chair, created in 1998 by Roberto Lazzeroni, reinterprets the archetypal chair by reducing its forms to the essentials. The structure, crafted from solid American walnut, features thin sections conveying lightness. Each detail showcases meticulous craftsmanship, ensuring high-quality furniture. The chair is distinguished by its curvilinear backrest made from a single, substantial piece of solid wood, and a seat constructed from curved multi-layered poplar veneered on top in walnut. The seat is flush with the frame and padded on top for comfort, available in fabric, leather, or natural leather.
